column4: anyone know a way to ssh to a remote desktop which has a firewalled router with no port forwarding?
if its behind  arouter an there is no port forwarding it will require hacking the roter
unless remote config is enabled
please elaborate
routers are firewalls by the fact that unexpectd packets are dropped due to the nature of nat
i meant about the remote config
so unless you have have remote config enable so you can turn it on, any data recieved on port 22 will be dropped
whats this remote config you speak off?
you cant turn on remote config so you can configure the router from the wan side, rather than LAN, this is off by default and is massively unsecure
oh, thaat wouldnt help
the config via web browser is only accessible via LAN
the problem is that ive lost the routers password and need the existing settings
but you CAN enable it but its a REALLY bad choixce
what does it involve (i dont think ill do it but just to have a loo)
then you'll need to find the default pass if you havent changed it
or you can hard reset it on the unit and reset it up
thats the problem - i dont know the password, and dont want to lose the settongs on it
depends how they are seen to ubuntu, if the inbox is simply a file, you can copy iy
it will vary wildly so you will have to investigate whats what first
I can use Wammu for backing up the messages but it doesn't transfer the dats and times - only for the inbox
its not something I do tbh
